A 3 day conference hosted on Hopin.io: A 3 day conference hosted on Hopin.io
All sponsor booths include a video, cust: All sponsor booths include a video, customizable experience, chat, and social media engagement. Click below to learn more.
Casual, facilitated, and interactive eve: Casual, facilitated, and interactive events for meeting and socializing with Fedorans.
Community events hosted around the world: Community events hosted around the world
During the Covid-19 pandemic, we created: During the Covid-19 pandemic, we created Nest as a virtual alternative to Flock. Now it exists as a virtual option for those who cannot attend in person. Making Flock accessible for everyone!
Explore the latest in Open Source: Explore the latest in Open Source
Flock attracts hundreds of amazing open: Flock attracts hundreds of amazing open source community members who work on and use software daily. Engage with our vibrant community in sessions and social hours.
Flock is an annual conference for contri: Flock is an annual conference for contributors of Fedora Linux. It is where the community plans and showcases the strategy and work on the project. Check out the recordings from previous years of Flock and Nest.
Flock offers an immersive in person expe: Flock offers an immersive in person experience. Attend sessions, collaborate with others, explore and meet new people. Plus, Flock is free to attend!
Interested in hosting your own event?: Interested in hosting your own event?
July 1 - 31 2023\nIn the month leading u:
July 1 - 31 2023
In the month leading up to Flock, Fedorans are encouraged to organize local community events. Set the format and topic of your choice. The Fedora Council will help support your initiative with financial and organizating aid. Click below to set up a Hatch! Deadline for submissions is May 29.
Looking for a date that is not listed? C: Looking for a date that is not listed? Click here for help.
New to Fedora? Check our **[community fo: New to Fedora? Check our **[community forum](https://discussion.fedoraproject.org/c/ask)** for support and help with frequently asked questions.
Our main IRC channel for the event is **: Our main IRC channel for the event is **\#fedora-flock** on **libera.chat**. Join **[\#fedora-flock](https://web.libera.chat/?channels=#fedora-flock)** to chat on Matrix or IRC.
Our tierd sponsorship levels will all gi: Our tierd sponsorship levels will all give you great visibility at Flock. Your booth will be showcased on the Expo page to maximize engagement.
Presentations that showcase the work don: Presentations that showcase the work done in Fedora and planning for the future.
Sponsors are advertised in several place: Sponsors are advertised in several places at Flock. We also post about sponsors on social media. Your brand will be distributed globally in our swag bag.
Thank you to our sponsors, supporting th: Thank you to our sponsors, supporting this event is one of the ways that they contribute to open source.
The Fedora Project envisions a world whe: The Fedora Project envisions a world where everyone benefits from free and open source software built by inclusive, welcoming, and open-minded communities. Stay connected during Flock through the following channels.
The location of Flock changes each year: The location of Flock changes each year between Europe and North America. In 2020 Fedorans went virtual with Nest, now we offer a hybrid version of Flock to make it more accessible to our community.
Use our messaging board Fedora Discussio: Use our messaging board Fedora Discussions to stay up to date on Flock Notifications. **[Check it out here](https://discussion.fedoraproject.org/)**.
Use the **\\#NestWithFedora** hashtags o: Use the **\#NestWithFedora** hashtags on your preferred social media platforms. Follow **[{'@'}fedora](https://twitter.com/fedora)** on Twitter for updates.
Workshops and hackfests offer opportunit: Workshops and hackfests offer opportunities for active learning and collaboration.
